Blue x Blue -> 1/4 BB

In the 4-way cross, 1, 2, 3, and 4 are parental alleles and B and T are the co-occurring parental alleles, each contributing one of their alleles to the offspring, resulting in a 4:1 combination of B:T. The sum of B:T alleles is equal to 4.

prompt.content:
One type of beetle has 3 possible wing colors, blue, green and turquoise. Randomly caught individuals of a polymorphic population were crossed with each other.
It is a monohybrid inheritance with three alleles, B, G & T. Dominance: B > G > T
You get the parent phenotype, and the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 - generation. State the genotypes of the parents and offspring as accurately as possible. No further explanation necessary. If a given distribution is impossible, state 'impossible'.
Example task:
Blue x Blue -> 4/4 Blue
Example solution:
BB x B_ -> 4/4 B_
Example Task:
Blue x Blue -> 3/4 Blue 1/4 Green
Example Solution:
BG x BG -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BG, 1/4 GG

data.expected: GT (Green) x GT (Green) -> 1/4 GG (Green), 1/2 GT (Green), 1/4 TT (Turquoise)
